title: NCK KRCHN Paper 1 MCQ Analysis 2024

question_sources.title: NCK KRCHN Paper 1 MCQs 2024 - ICU Focus

summary: This gives us a total of 476 questions to analyze against Paper 1 unit list. This is a very strong sample size and will give us a clear picture of the high-yield topics.
executive_summary: Pharmacology is King: By a significant margin, Pharmacology is the most tested unit. Questions on drug actions, side effects, patient education, and nursing considerations are everywhere.

The 'Big Four' Medical-Surgical Conditions: Four specific disease areas appear far more frequently than any others: Cardiovascular (CVD), Respiratory, Genitourinary (GUD/Renal), and Endocrine (especially Diabetes).
Procedural and Fundamental Nursing is Crucial: Questions on Theatre Nursing, Specialized Procedures, and Fundamentals (Basic Nursing) are heavily focused on safety, priority, and the nursing process.

focus: Drug Classes: ACE Inhibitors, Beta-blockers, Diuretics, NSAIDs, Opioids, Corticosteroids, Anticoagulants, Antibiotics
Side Effects: Dry cough (ACE), Hypokalemia (Furosemide), Hyperkalemia (Spironolactone)
Patient Education: e.g., take with meals, avoid grapefruit, rinse mouth after inhaler
Monitoring: INR, aPTT, potassium, glucose, liver enzymes
Heart Failure, Myocardial Infarction, Hypertension, DVT, PE
Asepsis, scrub/circulating roles, consent, patient positioning, instrument count, bleeding control
COPD, Asthma, Exacerbations, Oxygen therapy, Inhaler teaching
CKD, electrolyte imbalance, dietary management, phosphate binders, erythropoiesis agents
Ethics, Communication, ADPIE, Delegation, Evidence-based practice
Psoriasis, Contact Dermatitis, Herpes Zoster, Scabies, Erythema Multiforme
Stroke, Myasthenia Gravis, Spinal Cord Injury, Seizures, ICP
Shock types, ARDS, VAP, ICU complications of COPD, MI, AKI, HF
Diabetes (Type 1 & 2), DKA, hypoglycemia vs hyperglycemia, Insulins, Metformin

tier_3_low_yield.note: Focus on must-know conditions and emergencies only. E.g. Cirrhosis, Compartment Syndrome, ABCDE, Peptic Ulcer.

final_recommendations: Start with Pharmacology. Use flashcards, practice recall, and drill common drug groups.
Master high-frequency diseases: HF, MI, COPD, CKD, and Diabetes.
Always think Safety and Priority – these drive answers in procedures and fundamentals.
Practice scenario-based questions – not just fact recall.
Don’t waste time overstudying Tier 3 units. Focus on what moves the needle.
closing: You have taken the most important step by deciding to study strategically. This analysis gives you a clear road map. Follow it, and you will be well-prepared. Good luck with your revision!
